ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I developed my Spanish speaking, grammatical, but most of all, listening skills.
My knowledge of Spanish grammar and vocabulary expanded greatly, as did my ability to read Spanish texts/stories.
I learned Spanish.
I learned additional Spanish vocabulary and grammar concepts and further developed fluency.
Grammar was taught at a good pace, learned new tenses that I had not learned before, learned a lot about cultural content from different Spanish countries.
better spanish
I improved my grammar and speaking ability a lot in this class. In high school my teacher only focused on vocabulary and subjunctive and in this term I learned more than in the past 2 years.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I enjoyed the constant exposure and practice with Spanish. I had a bit of difficulty with transitioning into the constant Spanish, but it was ultimately helpful.
I think some of the assessments could be more spread out.
The largest strengths of the Spanish Department are their devoted faculty and everyday classes.
more interesting conversation. Talking about the reading, or grammar rules gets real old
The CC book and weekly story readings were very helpful in the class.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I really enjoyed the course, and would certainly recommend it to anyone who was looking to improve their Spanish abilities.
Spanish is super fun. Def take it if you want to learn the language!
If you are interesting in improving Spanish fluency or need a language requirement fulfilled, I would recommend this course.
Because you have to take a language, I would suggest spanish. Profe Reymundi is very nice and invested in your learning.

A necessary class for many students. Take it with Reymundi in part because she is the course director (think "writes the exams") but more importantly because she is an excellent instructor that cares about her students.
Yes, my professor was definitely helpful at giving feedback, Professor Reymundi is great at facilitating learning for her students.
If you take it, take it with Prof. Reymundishe's the best!
Yes! This level of Spanish improved my language skills.
